awd_titl_txt: Attendance of  U. S. Scholars at international              Freight Pipeline Symposium, July of 1992
awd_abstract_narration: This award provides partial travel support to 10 U.S. academic                  researchers to the International Freight Pipeline Symposium                     scheduled for July 6-8 in Wollongong, Australia.  Support is                    limited to those authors presenting a paper at the meeting.                     This Symposium is organized each three years, last time being                   held in U.S. in 1989.  Topics to be covered include capsule                     transport by pipelines, liquid-solid and gas-solid mixture                      flow, materials, turbomachinery, instrumentation, and various                   freight pipeline technologies.                                                                                                                                  Bulk and capsule transportation systems are presently used for                  various solids such as coal, limestone, copper concentrates,                    etc. and the technologies are rapidly improving.  The previous                  symposia were proven to be valuable forums for advancing new                    concepts and technologies in a interdisciplinary environment.//
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems
